content:
Both YogaGlo and Down Dog offer classes specifically designed for beginners and for people with back pain.

**YogaGlo**:

* They have a "Beginner's Series" that includes classes specifically designed for those new to yoga. These classes focus on fundamental postures, breathing techniques, and relaxation methods.
* They also offer classes labeled " Gentle" or "Easy" which are perfect for beginners or those who need a more gentle practice.
* For back pain, YogaGlo has classes specifically designed to help alleviate back pain, such as "Yoga for Back Pain" or "Gentle Back Care." These classes focus on gentle stretches, strengthening exercises, and relaxation techniques to help manage back pain.

**Down Dog**:

* They have a "Beginner's Program" that includes a series of classes designed to introduce you to the basics of yoga. These classes cover fundamental postures, breathing techniques, and relaxation methods.
* They also offer classes labeled "Beginner" or " Gentle" which are perfect for those new to yoga or looking for a more gentle practice.
* For back pain, Down Dog has classes specifically designed to help alleviate back pain, such as "Yoga for Back Pain" or "Back Care." These classes focus on gentle stretches, strengthening exercises, and relaxation techniques to help manage back pain.

Both YogaGlo and Down Dog offer classes that cater to different levels and needs. You can filter classes by level (beginner, intermediate, advanced), focus (back pain, stress relief, flexibility), or style (Hatha, Vinyasa, Restorative).

Before starting any new exercise program, it's essential to consult with a healthcare professional, especially if you have any underlying health conditions or concerns. They can help you determine the best approach for your specific needs.

Remember, yoga is not a one-size-fits-all practice. It's essential to listen to your body and modify or rest when needed. With YogaGlo and Down Dog, you can explore different classes and teachers to find what works best for you.
